item.name: Active GTP tunnels gtpu+gtpc
item.description: The number of currently active GTP tunnels on the GGSN. Each primary PDP context is counted twice for signaling tunnel and payload tunnel, and each secondary PDP context is counted once for payload tunnel only, as they share signaling tunnels with their primary PDP contexts

item.name: Active PDP contexts
item.description: The number of active PDP contexts on this GGSN. Incremented when a PDP context is activated and a GTP response has been sent to the SGSN. Decremented when a PDP context is deactivated.

item.name: Attempted activation
item.description: The number of PDP context activation procedures initiated by the MS on this GGSN. Incremented each time a Create PDP Context Request that is not silently discarded is received by the GGSN. This means the SNMP counter incremented each time a Create PDP Context Response is sent back to the SGSN with cause value Request Accepted or Request Rejected. Note: This counter cannot be retrieved by CLI.

item.name: Completed activation
item.description: The number of successfully completed PDP context activation procedures initiated by an MS. Incremented each time a Create PDP Context Response is sent back to an SGSN with cause value Request Accepted.

item.name: Completed deactivation
item.description: The number of successfully completed PDP context deactivation procedures initiated by an MS. Note: This counter can not be retrieved by CLI.

item.name: Completed manual deactivation
item.description: The number of successfully completed PDP context deactivation procedures initiated by the GGSN due to manual user command.

item.name: Completed self deactivation
item.description: The number of successfully completed PDP context deactivation procedures initiated by the GGSN. Note: This counter can not be retrieved by CLI.

item.name: Completed timeout deactivation
item.description: The number of successfully completed PDP context deactivation procedures initiated by the GGSN due to the idle supervision function. Note: The PDP context is supervised for the time it has been idle, without actual payload.

item.name: Completed update
item.description: The number of successfully completed PDP context update procedures initiated by an MS. Incremented each time an Update PDP Context Response is sent back to an SGSN with cause value Request Accepted.

item.name: Control packet drops GTP-C
item.description: The total number of GTP-C control packets that have been dropped by the node.

item.name: Error apn unknown
item.description: The number of GTP APN invalid errors sent by the GGSN

item.name: Error indication received GTP-U
item.description: The number of Error Indications received by the node (aggregate of error indications received by the GTP-U).

item.name: Error indication sent GTP-U
item.description: The number of Error Indications sent by the node (aggregate of error indications sent by the GTP-U). The GGSN may send an Error Indication to the SGSN or RNC if no PDP context exists or the PDP context is inactive for a received GTP Packet Data Unit (G-PDU).

item.name: Error pdp addr unknown
item.description: The number of GTP PDP address unknown errors sent by the GGSN.

item.name: Failed activation
item.description: The number of failed PDP context activation procedures initiated by an MS. Incremented each time a Create PDP Context Response is sent back to an SGSN with cause value Request Rejected.

item.name: Number of active PDP contexts per traffic class background
item.description: The number of active PDP contexts per Traffic Class, background.

item.name: Number of active PDP contexts per traffic class conversational
item.description: The number of active PDP contexts per Traffic Class, conversational.

item.name: Number of active PDP contexts per traffic class interactive
item.description: The number of active PDP contexts per Traffic Class, interactive.

item.name: Number of active PDP contexts per traffic class streaming
item.description: The number of active PDP contexts per Traffic Class, streaming.

item.name: Resources unavailable GTP
item.description: The number of GTP resources unavailable errors sent by the GGSN.

item.name: Session timeout deactivation
item.description: The number of successfully completed PDP context deactivation procedures initiated by the GGSN due to the duration supervision function. Note: The PDP context is supervised for the time it has been active, irrespective of the actual payload.

item_prototype.name: Incoming traffic, apn $1
item_prototype.description:
Total number of downlink Gn and S5 user plane bytes processed on a per APN basis by the GGSN or PGW. Incremented when a downlink packet is sent over the Gn or S5 user plane interface.
update too slow

item_prototype.name: Outgoing traffic, apn $1
item_prototype.description:
Total number of uplink Gn and S5 user plane bytes processed on a per APN basis by the GGSN or PGW. Incremented when an uplink packet received over the Gn or S5 user plane interface is sent over the Gi or SGi interface.
update to slow

trigger_prototype.name: Slump apn traffic, {#SNMPVALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: Резкое падение трафика. Если на APN за последний час больше 1кБ трафика, то берём последние значение, делим на среднее за час и смотрим, что получилось.

item_prototype.name: Cpu peack usage during last 5 sec ($1)

trigger_prototype.name: Packet Processor CPU too high
trigger_prototype.description: Packet Processor CPU usage > 80% during last 5 times

item_prototype.name: Cpu peack usage during last 5 sec ($1)

trigger_prototype.name: Session Controller CPU usage to high
trigger_prototype.description: Session Controller CPU usage > 80% during last 5 sec

item_prototype.name: Available ip-addresses in shared pool, $1
item_prototype.description:
pgwAvailableAddressesInSharedIpPool
Object Identifier: 1.3.6.1.4.1.10923.1.1.1.1.11.1.3
Type: GAUGE: INTEGER, 0..4294967295
Description: The number of available IP addresses in a shared IP pool.

item_prototype.name: Quarantine ip-addresses in shared pool, $1
item_prototype.description:
pgwAddressesInQuarantineInSharedIpPool
Object Identifier: 1.3.6.1.4.1.10923.1.1.1.1.11.1.4
Type: GAUGE: INTEGER, 0..4294967295
Description: The number of IP addresses that are in quarantine in a shared IP pool.

trigger_prototype.name: Available ip-addresses in shared pool to low, {#SNMPVALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: Available ip-addresses in shared pool to low

trigger.name: Free disk space is less than 20% on volume /var
